channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New bill would streamline process to OK medical providers for military service members
item.description: Recently introduced Senate legislation aims to cut red tape hindering health care services for current military members and veterans.

item.title: Meet The Saint Who Shaped The Modern Nativity Scene
item.description: 'Then His mother took Him to her heart, and with her cheek and breast warmed Him with great joy, and a mother’s tender compassion.'

item.title: Resolutions for Overcoming a Bad Year
item.description: For most of us, the resolutions we need to make to bounce back from a difficult year don’t have to be hyperspecific.

item.title: The Miraculous Song Sung Blue
item.description: Craig Brewer celebrates Neil Diamond’s ecumenical working-class pop.

item.title: Federal judge says Trump administration must restore disaster money to Democratic states

item.title: Secularized America Needs A Charlie Brown Christmas Now More Than Ever

item.title: President Trump’s ‘Golden Fleet,’ a Welcome Change
item.description: It is a relief to hear a president give more than lip service to what has become a crisis for our ability to project power.

item.title: Pilot-free flying taxis revving up to traverse U.S. skyways

item.title: Why We Still Love the Yule Log
item.description: Sixty Christmases ago, the icon made its television debut — and it’s still a backdrop to our holidays.

item.title: Why Bing Crosby’s ‘White Christmas’ Still Warms Our Hearts
item.description: The America of 1942 was vastly different from the America we know today, but its longings remain the same.

item.title: The CDC’s Hepatitis B Vaccine Decision Is Wrongheaded and Illogical
item.description: When vaccine guidance shifts without evidence, confusion rises — and more children are put at risk.

item.title: Christian Almost Murdered Twice By Islamists Finds Home In Canada For Christmas
item.description: Michael and his family no longer need fear for their lives, but the same cannot be said for the millions of Christians living in Pakistan.
